divs: Sighting DetailsI was traveling north on the Fairfax Co. Parkway between Herndon and Sterling around 8:00pm on March 4th when a large glowing object caught my eye. It was much larger than the largest star and was not as bright as a street light, hence why I described it as glowing. By the time my eyes were able to focus on the glowing circular object it started picking up speed. It moved northward horizontally in a strait line at amazing speed until it vanished. It made fighter jets look slow. Too bad I could not tell the size or altitude. I felt very excited and knew this was no normal craft. I'm sure some other people had to have seen this and I should have reported it sooner.
Summary: Circle glowing much larger that the largest star accelerated across the sky to amazing speed then vanished.
trends: There has been one other sighting in Herndon
